positive_examples: Some things must never be traded off against anything, no matter the cost.
This principle is inviolable - no amount of benefit could justify violating it.
Certain rights are absolute and cannot be weighed against consequences.
We don't do cost-benefit analysis on sacred values.
This is a line that must never be crossed, period.
negative_examples: Let's weigh the costs and benefits of different approaches.
Even important values sometimes need to be balanced against others.
Difficult trade-offs require considering all relevant factors.
Context matters when applying principles to real situations.
Most ethical decisions involve weighing competing values.
training_hints.disambiguation: Detects absolute value claims versus strong but contextual values. Key markers: never, inviolable, no matter the cost, absolute, cannot be weighed.

definition: A signal indicating values held as inviolable and not subject to tradeoffs.
